conclusion: Put the origin at the point P, the mid-point of AB.
Choose the x–axis along AB (positive to the right) and the y–axis vertically downward into the block.
In these coordinates A(–L,0), B(L,0), D(–L,L), C(L,L), P(0,0).
We must follow the ray from P to the point M on CD (y = L).
The incident ray makes an angle α = 37° with the surface.
The angle with the normal is θi = 90° – α = 53°.
Snell’s law (nair = 1, nblock = 4/3): sin θi = n sin θt.
Inside the block the ray makes an angle with the horizontal of β = 90° – θt ≈ 53.2°.
From P to CD the vertical drop is Δy = L.
With slope tan β, the associated horizontal displacement is Δx = Δy / tan β ≈ L / (tan 53.2°) ≈ L / (4/3) = 3L/4.
|Δx| = 0.75 L ≤ L, so the ray meets CD at a point M inside the side CD.
